Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2010 10:47AM momto4kids wrote: Thank you everyone who sent a reply to my post. Im not going to put this off at all, it has been on my mind a lot this weekend as im sure you can all understand. You have all helped me in knowing  what steps i need to take now and who i need to see first. I have called this morning and left a message about getting a mammogram done, Im going to hope and see if i can get a Digital one done. I just hope its not going to be a week or 2 wait !!. I will keep you all posted and let you know how it turns out..
Posts.Title: very worried found large lump momto4kids Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2010 04:35PM momto4kids wrote: Well in about a 1 hr i finally get to go see my new family Dr and i hope she will give the ok for me to get the Mammogram. When i got out the shower this morning i was looking at my left breast and where im  feeling the lump im pretty sure my breast is larger in that area just looking at it. When i look at it in the mirror it just looks different and not right.  Maybe im just going cray at this point and looking for things... anyway's  i hope i might have some answers in a hour.
Posts.Title: very worried found large lump momto4kids Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2010 10:52AM momto4kids wrote: Lisa1962 Thank you, you are very sweet. I had my mammogram yesterday morning than i had a ultrasound in the afternoon. After the ultrasound tech was done the tech had a Dr come in and look at the Pictures, they were thinking they could see something. After looking more they Believe its my implants  what is making the lump. I have no idea why my implant can make that size off a lump, i have had them i think around 8 or 9 years. Im going to make a apt to see the Dr who put them in. I just hope the Tech and the Dr yesterday are Right and that they are not missing anyting
Posts.Title: very worried found large lump momto4kids Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 07:00PM momto4kids wrote: Les  You a true Gentleman and your wife is very lucky to have you as you are to have her. I go tomorrow for my mammogram after i found a lump. My lump or mass is a little smaller than a golf ball and at the moment im really freaking out with worry. I have 4 children, my son is 19 and just left  home as he is in  the Military and i have no idea how he would deal with this.  My son and i are very close, and i think this would just devasate him esp with him now being so far away. I dont think im so scared  off what the results are going to be but im more upset at thinking how my husband and kids are going to be if i do have Cancer and how they are going to be feeling inside. I just hate to see them hurting and sad... Any way i wish you both well and will keep my fingers X for your wife and ((hug's))) to you.
Posts.Title: A thank you, from a husband Lesinindy Sassa

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2010 07:31PM momto4kids wrote: Well my new Dr is very nice and  so is the office girls so im happy i found them. I was worried about changing to a new Family Dr and off all the timming haha..  Well she did fill the lump and she is sending me for a Mammo this Thursday and than Next Wednesday for a  MRI. they only do the MRI on Wednesdays and they are all ready booked up. Can they tell much from the Mammogram alone?. I wish they could do everything on Thursday as be then i will already be a week off worry for me. \Thank you everyone for you Prayes and Good Lucks you have been sending my way

Posts.Content: momto4kids wrote: I hope im in the right place,  I’m  lucky to say that I have no family  members who have ever had breast cancer so i have no one to ask for any advice. A couple months ago I started to get some pain in my left breast, very painful pains that really did worry me. But being such a busy mom I told myself that I will see if it gets better.  Well the good thing is that yes the pain did get better, how ever yesterday in the shower I noticed that when I push down in the left breast I can fill a lump a hard lump. it’s a little smaller than  a golf  ball, it can move but just a little. Its more like it slides round if that makes sense ( but very very moment). Now the problem is I had breast implants several years ago, I have had 2 sets. My first Dr did such a horrible job that the 2nd Dr had to do reconstructive surgery. I have never noticed or felt this lump before. I even had my husband check it out yesterday to see if he had noticed it before and he had not. We are in the process off changing family Dr’s too which is horrible timing. We have a PPO so I know I can get a mammogram done without a referral but can some one give me some advice please as well as what kind off Dr I should be looking for. I’m 34 with 4 children Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: very worried found large lump momto4kids Lisa1962
